title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (Gas)
text_raw:
1. (1) This Order may be cited as the Electricity Regulation Act 1999 (Gas) 

Levy Order 2023 

(2) This Order comes into operation on 31 December 2023. 

(3) The Electricity Regulation Act, 1999 and Gas (Interim) (Regulation) 
Act 2002 (Gas) Levy Order, 2022 (S.I No.624 of 2022) is revoked as and from 
1 January 2024.
text_norm: 1 (1) order may cited electricity regulation act 1999 (gas) levy order 2023 (2) order come operation 31 december 2023 (3) electricity regulation act 1999 gas (interim) (regulation) act 2002 (gas) levy order 2022 (s.i no.624 2022) revoked 1 january 2024

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 2. (1) In this Order -
text_raw:
2. (1) In this Order - 

"the Act" means the Electricity Regulation Act, 1999 (No. 23 of 1999) as 
amended by the Gas Act; 

"days" means calendar days; 

" Code" means the code of operations of Gas Networks Ireland in relation to 
the transmission system of Gas Networks Ireland as that Code may be amended 
or varied from time to time and any successor code or arrangement; 

"the Commission" means the Commission for Regulation of Utilities 
established under the Act; 

"Final Allocations" means Final Allocations at the Exit Points; 

"the Gas Act" means the Gas (Interim) (Regulation) Act, 2002; 

"levy year" means a calendar year; 

"quarter" means a period of 3 months ending on 31 March, 30 June, 30 
September, or 31 December; 

"relevant percentage" for a Shipper in respect of any quarter means the 
percentage (rounded upwards to four decimal places) which the aggregate of 
the Final Allocations allocated to that Shipper in respect of the immediately 
preceding quarter represents of the aggregate of the Final Allocations allocated 
to all Shippers in respect of the immediately preceding quarter; 

and any cognate words shall be construed accordingly. 

(2) In this Order unless it is otherwise indicated- 

(a) 

all words and expressions defined in the Act or in the Gas Act 
shall have the same meanings when used in this Order and 
where in any case a word or expression used in this Order is 
defined in each of the Act and the Gas Act, the word or 
expression shall have the meaning given to it by the Gas Act for 
the purposes of this Order; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 5th December, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [600] 3 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

all words and expressions defined in the Code shall have the 
same meanings when used in this Order; 

a reference to legislation is a reference to that legislation as 
amended from time to time; 

a reference to an article or schedule is to an article of, or 
schedule to, this Order; and 

a reference to a sub-article is to the sub-article of the provision 
in which the reference occurs.

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 3. This Order shall apply to the classes of natural gas undertakings set out
text_raw:
3. This Order shall apply to the classes of natural gas undertakings set out 

in the Schedule to this Order ("relevant undertakings").
text_norm: 3 order shall apply class natural gas undertaking set schedule order ( relevant undertaking )

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 4. (1) A levy is hereby imposed on each relevant undertaking. This levy
text_raw:
4. (1) A levy is hereby imposed on each relevant undertaking. This levy 

will be payable in respect of each levy year. 

(2) The levy imposed by sub-article (1) shall be payable in quarterly 
instalments in each case no later than the day which is 30 days after the date on 
which a request for payment of the levy instalment is made by the 
Commission.
text_norm: 4 (1) levy hereby imposed relevant undertaking levy payable respect levy year (2) levy imposed sub-article (1) shall payable quarterly instalment case later day 30 day date request payment levy instalment made commission

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 5. (1) The levy imposed shall be payable by the relevant undertaking
text_raw:
5. (1) The levy imposed shall be payable by the relevant undertaking 
separately for each activity of transmission, distribution, or shipping of natural 
gas, as the case may be, that is carried out by the relevant undertaking in 
Ireland. 

(2) The amount of the levy imposed on a relevant undertaking in respect of 

any quarter shall be as follows: 

(a) 

(b) 

in the case of Gas Networks Ireland, in respect of such 
transmission activities, a fixed payment of €613,187 

in the case of Gas Networks Ireland, in respect of such 
distribution activities, a fixed payment of €613,187; and 

(c) 

in the case of a Shipper, the relevant percentage of €613,187
text_norm: 5 (1) levy imposed shall payable relevant undertaking separately activity transmission distribution shipping natural gas case may carried relevant undertaking ireland (2) amount levy imposed relevant undertaking respect quarter shall follows (a) (b) case gas network ireland respect transmission activity fixed payment eur613 187 case gas network ireland respect distribution activity fixed payment eur613 187 (c) case shipper relevant percentage eur613 187

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 6. On or before the last day of the first month of each quarter Gas
text_raw:
6. On or before the last day of the first month of each quarter Gas 
Networks Ireland shall supply to the Commission the information required to 
calculate the relevant percentage for each Shipper in respect of the immediately 
preceding quarter. In the event that Gas Networks Ireland fails for any reason 
to supply any of the information required for this purpose the Commission 
shall be entitled to calculate the relevant percentage for any shipper in respect 
of the last quarter for which such information was available.

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 7. (1) Where any amount falling to be paid under Article 5 is not paid
text_raw:
7. (1) Where any amount falling to be paid under Article 5 is not paid 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [600] 

within the period for payment specified in Article 4, interest thereon shall 
accrue at the prescribed interest rate compounded monthly from the date when 
such payment is due until the same is made. 

(2) In this Regulation, "the prescribed interest rate" means a rate 2% per 

annum above the Euribor rate.
text_norm: 7 (1) amount falling paid article 5 paid 4 600 within period payment specified article 4 interest thereon shall accrue prescribed interest rate compounded monthly date payment due made (2) regulation prescribed interest rate mean rate 2 per annum euribor rate

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: 8. (1) All payments shall be made in Euro on the due date by direct bank
text_raw:
8. (1) All payments shall be made in Euro on the due date by direct bank 
transfer or equivalent instantaneous transfer of funds to the bank account 
specified by the Commission. 

(2) Relevant undertakings shall notify the Commission as soon as payment 
has been made, indicating the date on which payment was made and the name 
of the bank effecting payment. 

(3) A request for payment by the Commission to the relevant undertakings 
under this Order shall be made to the relevant undertaking in accordance with 
Section 4 of the Act. 

 
 
 
 
 [600] 5 

Schedule 

The relevant undertakings for the purposes of this Levy Order are a class 
consisting of any person engaged in the transmission or distribution of natural 
gas or as a Shipper. 

Sealed with the common seal of the Commission for 
Regulation of Utilities on 1 December, 2023. 

JIM GANNON, 

Chairperson of the Commission. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [600]

title: The Commission for Regulation of Utilities in exercise of the powers conferred
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This order imposes a levy on certain specified classes of natural gas 
undertakings, for the purpose of meeting expenses properly incurred by the 
Commission for Regulation of Utilities in the discharge of its functions under 
the Gas Acts 1976 to 2002. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [600] 7
